title: Reliability Engineer
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:** 




 This position will support the Mont Belvieu Complex and serves as a knowledgeable source of equipment within the facility.  The individual will work closely with the maintenance department, operations, and process engineering personnel to provide technical input on equipment repairs, improvements, and troubleshooting efforts.  This position also plays a key role in continuous improvement to better ensure overall mechanical integrity, facility safety, and equipment reliability.  The engineer serves a "hands\\-on" role working alongside and supporting process and facilities technicians as needed.  This role is essential to the operation and reliability of Targa's entire value chain.
 



  
 



**JOB FUNCTIONS AND KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:** 




        Technical support for daily operations and maintenance activities
 



        Support of rotating and stationary equipment field repairs
 



        Possess knowledge of codes, standards, and regulations related to refining, petrochemical, or midstream energy business
 



        Provide technical support to engineering projects team on capital projects
 



        Develop equipment repair work scopes
 



        Perform initial equipment troubleshooting with maintenance and/or operations
 



        Perform data collection for failure analyses
 



        Review existing equipment spare parts and PM plans for modifications
 



        MOC lead for field changes
 



        Provides oversight to fixed and rotating equipment installation, troubleshooting, repair, and startup activities.
 



        Recommend reliability or optimization projects to respective teams
 



        Assist in developing and implementing inspection programs (mechanical and metallurgical) to maximize the on\\-stream time of major equipment.
 



        Ability to follow and adhere to all applicable safety regulations including, but not limited to, Targa's processes and procedures, Site Specific Rules, State and Federal regulations.
 



        Auditory attention and hearing sensitivity is required, as candidates must possess the ability to distinguish various sounds that serve as key maintenance and safety indicators
 



        Other duties as assigned
 




**MINIMUM ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS:** 




        Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or an Equivalent Engineering Degree from a 4\\-year accredited University
 



        Minimum 3\\-5 years of experience in the refining, petrochemical, or midstream process industries
 



        Proficient in Microsoft Office Products, including Work and Excel
 



        Ability to interface effectively with all levels within the company as well as organizations outside the company
 



        Valid driver license required
 



        Follow and adhere to all applicable Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) guidelines
 



        Interpersonal communication skills are required to interface with all affected crafts, personnel, contractors, and customers
 



        Ability to work self\\-sufficiently given direction and resources
 



        Ability to think critically, solve problems independently and exercise excellent judgment and logic
 



        Regular and reliable attendance is required
 








**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:** 




        5\\-10 years of experience in the refining, petrochemical, or midstream process industries
 



        Knowledge of applicable industry codes, including API 510, API 570, API 610, API 618, and B31\\.3
 



        Strong knowledge of PSM/PHA methodologies and best practices
 



        Familiarity with one or more formal root cause analysis methodologies
 



        Experience with Microsoft Project
 



        Experience with Power BI
 



        Experience with Maximo or other computerized maintenance management system
 



        Experience with steam generation systems desired
 



        Experience with pumps, steam turbines, and reciprocating \\& centrifugal compressors
 



        Experience with heat exchangers, piping systems, tanks, and process vessels
 



        Ability to read P\\&IDs efficiently. Ability to read isometric drawings of both piping systems and pressure vessels.
 



        Possess or ability to require training in metallurgy.
 



        Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to act as a resource for providing customer service in a courteous manner and work effectively with diverse groups of people at various levels within an organization. Writing skills sufficient to compose and edit a variety of documents using correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation, with the ability to pay close attention to detail and proofread work carefully.
 



        Ability to work accurately, with interruptions, to meet deadlines. 
 



        Ability to work in a flexible way that allows for changes in assignments and priorities depending upon identified needs of the unit.
 



        Good organizational, time management, customer service and problem\\-solving skills and the ability to work accurately and meet deadlines with frequent interruptions.  Organizational skills sufficient to prioritize work and complete assignments accurately, either independently or as part of a team, under the pressure of completing deadlines with frequent interruptions.  Ability to work autonomously following directions, policies, or procedures. Ability to use analytical and decision\\-making skills to recommend options and resolve problems in a variety of contexts.
 








**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** 




        Ability to lift, push, and pull 50 pounds
 



        Ability to work in changing climate conditions and a plant environment
 



        Able to work in close quarters: i.e., work while kneeling, squatting, sitting, climbing, and standing.
 



        Follow and adhere to all applicable Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) guidelines (ex: eye protection, footwear, FRC).
 



        The employee frequently is required to stand, walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
 








**EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY:** 




 Targa Resources provides equal employment opportunities based on merit, experience, and other work\\-related criteria and without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, sex, age, pregnancy, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. We also strive to provide reasonable accommodation to employees' beliefs and practices that do not conflict with Targa's policies and applicable law. We value the unique contributions that every employee brings to their role with Targa.

title: Business Manager-Plastics Sales
description:
About Vibrantz Technologies
 







 Vibrantz Technologies ("Vibrantz" or "Company") is a leading global provider of specialty chemicals and materials solutions whose purpose is to bring color, performance and vibrancy to life. Every day, our employees, the products we make, and our valued customer partnerships are inspired by this purpose. Serving customers globally, our innovations are trusted in a variety of advanced materials, color solutions and performance coatings applications to enhance the hue, functionality, safety and environmental footprint of everyday consumer products. Our key competencies in particle engineering, glass and ceramic science and color technology enable benefits like more durable vehicles and batteries, easier\\-to\\-clean appliances, energy efficient roof tiles and bricks, stronger and more decorative glass, and eco\\-friendly paints. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, Vibrantz has over 60 manufacturing facilities and sales offices on six continents and employs roughly 4,000 individuals. We are building a strong, shared culture that is rooted strongly in our six core values that focus on safety, our people, customers, excellence in all we do, environmental stewardship, and integrity, ethics, and trust. And we are intent upon fostering a workplace that engages employees' heads, hands and \\- uniquely \\- their hearts.
 







 Vibrantz is owned by American Securities, a leading U.S. private equity firm that invests in market\\-leading North American companies with annual revenue generally ranging from $200 million to $2 billion and/or $50 million to $200 million of EBITDA. American Securities and its affiliates have approximately $23 billion under management and are based in New York with an office in Shanghai.
 







 For more information, please visit www.vibrantz.com and www.american\\-securities.com.
 



**Job Function** 








 The Business Manager (BM) will lead efforts to grow plastics sales across North America, driving revenue and meeting gross profit (GP) targets. This role involves managing select key accounts, aligning sales activities with budget goals, and collaborating closely with Coatings and Plastics Segment Business Managers and their sales teams to expand market share and secure new plastics sales.
 







**Responsibilities** 



* **Sales Strategy Development:** 
  

 Develop and execute sales strategies to expand market share and drive revenue growth, ensuring alignment with budgeted revenue and GP objectives.
* **Key Account Ownership:** 
  

 Manage select key accounts, ensuring alignment with revenue goals and cultivating relationships to drive long\\-term growth.
* **Collaborative Growth Initiatives:** 
  

 Partner with Coatings and Plastics Segment Business Managers and their sales teams to increase market share and boost dry plastics sales.
* **Team Coaching and Mentorship:** 
  

 Train and mentor the sales team, providing them with the knowledge and tools needed to identify and secure new business opportunities effectively.
* **Market Expertise:** 
  

 Stay updated on plastics technologies and industry trends to guide sales strategies and ensure competitive product offerings.
* **Creative Sourcing Solutions:** 
  

 Identify and negotiate opportunities for importing and reselling plastics from global suppliers to diversify product offerings and improve profitability.
* **Leadership of Sales Initiatives:** 
  

 Lead targeted sales initiatives aligned with company objectives, tracking progress towards achieving set goals.
* **Performance Analysis and Reporting:** 
  

 Monitor sales performance metrics, providing regular reports with insights and strategic recommendations to leadership.
* **Global Collaboration:** 
  

 Coordinate with commercial leadership and account managers across regions to align on growth initiatives, share best practices, and leverage synergies.
* **Relationship Management:** 
  

 Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers and stakeholders, ensuring high levels of satisfaction and fostering loyalty.







**Required Experience** 



* Bachelor's degree in Business, Chemistry, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in business development or sales management within plastics or related industries.
* In\\-depth knowledge of plastics technologies, applications, and market dynamics.
* Strong leadership skills with experience in coaching and developing high\\-performing sales teams.
* Ability to identify and pursue creative sourcing opportunities in a global marketplace.
* Exceptional analytical skills with a data\\-driven approach to decision\\-making.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for engaging with diverse stakeholders.
* Willingness to travel as needed to meet clients and support business initiatives.







**Benefits** 








 We offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, paid vacation, and 401K.
 



**Location** 







 Houston, TX
 
 Vibrantz is committed to protecting your privacy. We provide a Website Privacy Policy located on our Vibrantz.com site to explain the type of information we collect and to inform you of the specific practices and guidelines that protect the security and confidentiality of your personal data. Please read that policy carefully. If any term in the policy is unacceptable to you, please do not use the Website or provide any personal data. This policy may change from time to time (see Revisions to Our Privacy Policy on Vibrantz.com).

title: SmartPlant P&ID Administrator
description:
At Motiva, our employees' energy, passion, and dedication to excellence are what make us who we are and what allows us to generate energy that makes a house a home, gets us from point A to point B, and enables our health and wellbeing. We invest in every aspect of our employees' lives because, at Motiva, our people matter.
   

  

 Headquartered in Houston, Texas, Motiva refines, distributes and markets petroleum products throughout the Americas. The company's Port Arthur Manufacturing Complex in Port Arthur, TX, is comprised of North America's largest refinery with a total throughput of 720,000 barrels per day, the world's second largest base oil plant, and an integrated chemical plant. Under exclusive long\\-term brand licenses with Shell and Phillips 66 (for the 76® brand), Motiva's commercial operations supply more than 12 billion gallons of fuel to customers annually. Motiva is wholly owned by Aramco, one of the world's largest integrated energy and chemicals companies.
   

  

 Position Overview:
   

  

 The Motiva SmartPlant P\\&ID Administrator (SPPID Admin) reports to Sr. Manager, Engineering Design Technology (EDT) and serves as the corporate technical expert for Motiva's Smart P\\&IDs and other 2D Design applications. The purpose of this position is to ensure that As\\-Built and project databases for Motiva's P\\&IDs are maintained and properly managed to ensure the safe, reliable operations of Motiva's facilities and provide a competitive advantage through efficient project design and improved operational performance.
   

  

 The SPPID Admin provides leadership and advanced support and establishes Motiva's long and short\\-term strategy for all matters related to SmartPlant P\\&ID. They provide assurance and develop standards and guides to ensure proper and consistent use of the tool for projects, operations, and maintenance. They provide technical expertise and support on system design, software upgrades and troubleshooting. They also are responsible for workflow process development and user training for EPC partners including HVECs.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

 Specific job duties or deliverables that the position requires which will also measure performance:
   

* Administration of Engineering Design applications \\- Smart P\\&ID, other 2D design applications
	+ Setup and configuration, installation, user access control, backup, troubleshooting, project data cleanup, database administration, report customization etc.
	+ Ownership of the P\\&ID data management for projects, operations, and maintenance.
	+ Smart P\\&ID automation programming
	+ Customization of reference data, synchronization activities, workshare collaboration and quality checks
	+ Responsible to maintain and document reference data standards, attributes across the sites, maintain project deliverables and training materials.
	+ Coordinate with design team, project team, document management team and technical groups to provide operations and maintenance support.
	+ Support document management application in conjunction with Management of Change (MOC), revision management and data handover
	+ Assist IT in planning and implementation of software upgrades and patches.


* Function as the front\\-end technical interface with EPCs, third party vendors for software testing assignments and application support.
* Provide technical guidance, training, and support to 2D designers, application end users and superusers within Motiva, EPCs and HVECs on subjects related to Motiva's 2D design work procedures and standards.
* Develop standard procedures and project guides, quality assurance documents for maintenance, operations, and projects.
* Stay abreast of updates and/or changes to industry standards and practices.
* Communicate strategies, risks, and recommendations to Motiva Leadership regarding technical approach for design project execution, data extraction, to improve the quality of project deliverables.


 Requirements:
   

  

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

 Areas in this section will remove any one from consideration that does not meet basic qualifications, and these are auditable during Department of Labor or OFCCP audits.
   

  

* Must have legal authorization to work in the US on a full\\-time basis for anyone other than current employer.
* 5\\+ Years of relevant Hexagon SPID Administration experience
* 10\\+ Years of experience in project execution regarding P\\&ID development and engineering design for oil and gas, petrochemical and/or chemical industry
* Training certification on Hexagon SPID Administration and Advanced User
* Proven experience administering, troubleshooting, and customizing of Hexagon's SPPID
* Strong knowledge of Smart Engineering Tools
* Understanding of database architecture related to Hexagon's Smart applications, Oracle/SQL database structure, Oracle report builder and SQL developer.
* Knowledge of PIP standards and practices (PIC001\\)
* Strong Communication and engagement skills


  

 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

 Desirable knowledge, skills, abilities related to the role which may include soft skills, but these will not remove candidates from hiring manager consideration if they are not present in the resume.
   

  

* Ability to think analytically and adapt quickly.
* Self\\-driven and motivated
* Conceptual thinker and able to work with complex systems.
* Experience with P\\&ID field walkdowns
* Experience working for an owner/operator.


 Internal posting only: The salary grade of this role is commensurate with experience. The role is expected to be a salary grade 16\\-18\\.
   

  

 We reserve the right to amend or withdraw Motiva jobs at any time, including prior to the closing date. Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or grade.
   

  

 Applicants for regular U.S. positions must be authorized to work in the United States for Motiva Enterprises LLC without the need for sponsorship of an immigration authorization or visa (for example, TN, H\\-1B, or other employment\\-based immigration authorization or visa).
   

  

 Motiva participates in E\\-Verify.
   

  

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information, or other protected status under federal, state, or local laws.

title: Portfolio Valuation, Senior Associate / Manager -  Upstream Oil & Gas
description:
**Position Overview:** 




 Our client is an expanding Oil \\& Gas firm, based in Houston, Texas. They are seeking a highly skilled professional to provide timely and insightful valuations and investment reporting for key stakeholders across a diverse range of Upstream Oil \\& Gas investments.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Investor Reporting:** 
 Lead the monthly investor reporting process for Upstream Oil \\& Gas assets, including valuation support, return calculations, benchmarking, and performance measurement insights.
* **Presentation Development:** 
 Create and update investor presentations to support the reporting process and communicate key financial insights.
* **Valuation \\& Analysis:** 
 Perform detailed valuations of Upstream O\\&G assets and reserves, using Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis and industry benchmarks (transactions/peer company multiples).
* **Risk \\& Hedging:** 
 Analyze portfolio\\-level risk exposure and assess hedging strategies to mitigate risk and optimize returns.
* **Cross\\-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with portfolio companies and internal teams (investments, accounting, finance, tax, treasury) to gather data and perform in\\-depth analysis.
* **3rd\\-Party Valuation Process:** 
 Manage and serve as the key point of contact for the annual third\\-party valuation process to support administration of Long\\-Term Incentive Plans (LTIP).
* **FP\\&A Support:** 
 Provide valuation\\-related support to the FP\\&A team during the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and multi\\-year planning processes.
* **Investment Management Support:** 
 Actively support cross\\-functional teams across all aspects of investment management.



**Position Requirements:** 



* Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, petroleum engineering, or a related field.
* CFA or CAIA designations are a plus.
* At least 4\\-7 years of experience in Oil \\& Gas valuation and performance analysis within a financial services firm or professional service, strong expertise in asset valuation and investment reporting.
* Proficiency in sophisticated financial modeling, with the ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with internal teams.
* Experience in investor reporting is highly desirable.
* Advanced skills in financial analysis, reporting, and presentation software (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, financial modeling tools).

title: Operations Analyst
description:
**Description** 



 Introduction
 
 Do you have the career opportunities as an Operations Analyst you want with your current employer? We have an exciting opportunity for you to join Parallon which is part of the nation's leading provider of healthcare services, HCA Healthcare.
 


 Benefits
 
 Parallon, offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:
 


* Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation.
* Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long\\-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more.
* Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing
* 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock
* Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance.
* Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more
* Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts
* Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships
* Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)
* Colleague recognition program
* Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long\\- and short\\-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)
* Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee\\-only coverage to full\\-time and part\\-time colleagues based on income.



 Learn more about Employee Benefits
 



***Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.***
  





 Our teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. Do you want to work as an Operations Analyst where your passion for creating positive patient interactions is valued? If you are dedicated to caring for the well\\-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise!
 


 Job Summary and Qualifications
 











  


 As an Operation Analyst, you will be responsible for assisting the company in monitoring and optimizing operations. You will also interpret, design, and develop appropriate analyses to solve complex operational and/or financial problems. You will also assist with developing and reviewing any reports necessary to support Parallon operations, including the development of tools to effectively measure performance.  
 


  


  In this role you will:  
 


  





  





* Access data for analysis using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, MicroStrategy Visual Insight, SQL, Power BI, etc.)
* Develop and produce month\\-end reports for internal and external use.
* Support department in retrieving and organizing the necessary data for reporting.
* Communicate results of the analysis to various levels of the organization including Executive Leadership.
* Establish benchmark performance metrics for services, centers, and employees
* Develop, analyze and interpret key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Review efficiency and effectiveness of operations workflows/procedures.
* Evaluate inventory strategies, including conducting champion challenger tests
* Create process documentation
* Ad hoc client profitability/performance analysis; account for business changes.
* Revenue forecasting and budgeting.
* Operational modeling based on fixed variables and key business drivers.
* Pre\\-sale pricing models and post\\-mortem for live clients.


  





  





  





  





  





  





  





  





  





  





  





  





  


  Qualifications:  
 


  





  





* BA/BS with coursework in MIS, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science OR 3\\+ years in Report/Business Analyst role.
* At least 3 to 5 years of experience performing significant data and process analysis, including ad hoc queries, metric development, process flows, and comparative analyses. (e.g. Tableau, MicroStrategy, Visual Insight, SQL, Power BI, etc.)
* Intermediate level of proficiency with PC\\-based software programs and automated database management systems required (Excel, Access, PowerPoint).
* SQL experience and Six Sigma experience (Green Belt equivalent) are a plus.
* Demonstrated process improvement, workflow, benchmarking, and/or evaluation of business processes required.
* Demonstrated understanding of data modeling (relationships, data types, tables, etc.) and analytics concepts (queries, reporting, and association of data sources) required.


  





  





  





  





  






**Parallon** 
 provides full\\-service revenue cycle management, or total patient account resolution, for HCA Healthcare. Our services include scheduling, registration, insurance verification, hospital billing, revenue integrity, collections, payment compliance, credentialing, health information management, customer service, payroll and physician billing. We also provide full\\-service revenue cycle management as well as targeted solutions, such as Medicaid Eligibility, for external clients across the country. Parallon has over 17,000 colleagues, and serves close to 1,000 hospitals and 3,000 physician practices, all making an impact on patients, providers and their communities.
 



 HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies® by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3\\.7 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.
 


  





 "Bricks and mortar do not make a hospital. People do."\\- Dr. Thomas Frist, Sr.
   

 HCA Healthcare Co\\-Founder
 
 If you are looking for an opportunity that provides satisfaction and personal growth, we encourage you to apply for our Operations Analyst opening. We promptly review all applications. Highly qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews.
 **Unlock the possibilities and apply today!** 




 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Pharmacy Technologist - Galveston Inpatient (Nights)
description:
****Minimum Qualifications:****




**EDUCATION \\& EXPERIENCE** 



* High school diploma or equivalent
* Two (2\\) years of pharmacy technician experience OR Associate of Applied Science in Pharmacy Technician
* Four (4\\) or more advanced Pharmacy Technologist competencies:
	+ Prepares and/or oversees preparation of complex prescription medications or medications that require special handling within assigned area such as extemporaneous non\\-sterile compounded products, sterile compounded IV products or specialty medications
	+ Participates in the operations of medication therapy management
	+ Initiates medication reconciliation
	+ Assists with screening, documentation, and preparation of immunizations
	+ Works with patients, providers, and payers to obtain prior authorization
	+ Resolves billing/adjudication issues encountered in the processing of prescription
	+ Proficient in the use of financial assistance software
	+ Proficient in C2 safe operation and/or OR anesthesia narcotic reconciliation
	+ Advanced skill in the use of technology within area of assignment
	+ Works with leaders and team members to solve problems within assigned area
	+ Ability to train new employees within area of assignment
	+ Demonstrates the ability to communicate with other healthcare professionals effectively and professionally
	+ Ability to apply accepted procedures in inventory control of medications, equipment, devices, and other supplies
	+ Supports pharmacy compliance with professional standards and relevant legal, regulatory, formulary, contractual, and safety requirements
	+ Performs system data entry of information such as referral requests, drug utilization management information, prepacking information, drug purchasing information, or non\\-formulary approval information



**LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS OR CERTIFICATIONS** 




**Required:** 




 Registered as a Pharmacy Technician with the Texas State Board of Pharmacy (TSBP)
 



**OR** 




 Registered as a 
 *Pharmacist* 
  Intern with the Texas State Board of Pharmacy (TSBP)
 



**Preferred:** 




 ACPE approved IV (sterile products) certification a plus.
 







**JOB DESCRIPTION** 




 The Senior Pharmacy Technologist assists pharmacists in providing drug distribution, technical services, and clinical services associated with the preparation, storage, and dispensing of pharmaceuticals. The Senior Pharmacy Technologist provides technical support and addresses problems related to the assigned area and only passes complex issues to the relevant Lead Pharmacy Technologist and/or Supervisor as needed.
 







**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS** 



* Prepares unit\\-dose medications specific to patient needs including patient's weight, allergies, and age (e.g., pediatric, neonate, adolescent, adult, and geriatric).
* Retrieves and delivers inpatient medication orders and supplies.
* Prepares sterile products utilizing aseptic technique and USP 797 standards.
* Compounds bulk and extemporaneous pharmaceuticals specific to patient's needs including weight and age (e.g., pediatric, neonate, adolescent, adult, and geriatric) utilizing USP 795 standards.
* Demonstrates the ability to operate automated technology including compounding, repackaging, cart fill, and other automated drug systems.
* Communicates effectively with other pharmacy employees, healthcare professionals, and patients while appropriately recognizing age (e.g., pediatric, neonate, adolescent, adult, and geriatric).
* Maintains adequate drug inventories in pharmacy area and patient care areas and notifies the appropriate personnel when shortages and/or outages noted.
* Performs quality assurance/improvement audits.
* Maintains a neat, clean, and organized work area.
* Demonstrates flexibility in staffing assignments.
* Adheres to internal controls established for the department.
* Assists pharmacists in filling ambulatory prescriptions specific to patient needs including patient's weight, allergies, and age (e.g., pediatric, neonate, adolescent, adult, and geriatric).
* Assists in record keeping activities in any assigned area.
* Assists and supports the Lead Pharmacy Technologist as needed.
* Adheres to internal controls and reporting structure.
* Performs related duties as required.



  
 



**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES** 



* Effective communication skills
* Demonstrates ability to prioritize and solve problems
* Must have current knowledge of safety regulations and experience in the implementation of new policies and procedures.
* Able to spend most of the day standing, walking, or bending.  Able to sit, stand, walk, bend, stoop, pull, reach, push up to 50 lbs., and regularly and occasionally lift 0\\-30 lbs.



  
 



**WORK SCHEDULE** 




 Night shift
 













**Equal Employment Opportunity**

As a VEVRAA Federal Contractor, UTMB Health takes affirmative action to hire and advance women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Senior Director, CPQ Modernization Leader
description:
Senior Director, CPQ Modernization Leader
 







 This role has been designed as 'Hybrid' with an expectation that you will work on average 2\\-3 days per week from an HPE office.
 






















**Who We Are:** 
































 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge\\-to\\-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today's complex world.Our culture thrives onfinding new and better ways to accelerate what's next.We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs.We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you.Open up opportunities with HPE.
 

























**:** 




    
 





 We are seeking a highly motivated and innovative Modern CPQ Solution Leader to join our growing team. In this critical role, you will be responsible for leading the evaluation, selection, implementation, and ongoing optimization of our CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) platform. You will play a key role in streamlining our sales processes, improving sales efficiency, and accelerating revenue growth.
 









**Key Responsibilities:** 










**Lead the evaluation and selection of a modern CPQ platform, including:** 





* Conducting thorough market research and vendor analysis.




* Defining and documenting requirements and use cases.




* Leading proof\\-of\\-concept projects and evaluating solutions.




* Participating in RFP/RFI processes and vendor negotiations.









**Drive the successful implementation of the chosen CPQ platform, including:** 





* Project managing the implementation process, including data migration, user training, and go\\-live.




* Working closely with cross\\-functional teams (Sales, Marketing, IT, Finance) to ensure a smooth transition.




* Configuring the CPQ platform to meet specific business needs and workflows.




* Developing and maintaining comprehensive documentation.









**Optimize and enhance the CPQ platform, including:** 





* Continuously monitoring and analyzing platform performance and user adoption.




* Identifying and implementing process improvements and system enhancements.




* Providing ongoing training and support to sales teams.




* Staying abreast of industry best practices and emerging CPQ technologies.









**Drive data\\-driven decision making, including:** 





* Leveraging CPQ data to analyze sales trends, identify opportunities, and improve sales performance.




* Generating reports and dashboards to track key metrics and measure ROI.











**Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, including:** 





* Building strong relationships with sales, marketing, IT, finance, and other stakeholders.




* Collaborating on product launches, pricing strategies, and go\\-to\\-market plans.









**Qualifications** 
 :
 




* The ideal candidate will have a strong background in CPQ architecture, and end\\-to\\-end implementation and operations.




* Demonstrated success in leading and managing large\\-scale CPQ implementation projects, including program management, budgeting, and stakeholder management.




* Deep understanding of the Informatica platform suite, Salesforce, Oracle and other CPQ solutions and their capabilities, including custom built CPQ applications.




* Extensive experience in overseeing and executing all stages of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.




* Proven experience in leading and managing teams responsible for developing customer applications using Java stack technologies, ensuring high\\-quality deliverables and adherence to project timelines.




* Strong leadership and team management skills, managing in\\-house and SI resources.




* Experience in vendor management, contract negotiation and budget management




* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with key stakeholders across the organization.




* Experience leading enterprise\\-grade CPQ design, solutioning, and implementation.




* ITIL implementation experience.









**Education and Experience:** 





* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.




* 15\\+ years of experience, including 5 years in a senior leadership role.




















**Additional Skills:** 










 Accountability, Accountability, Action Planning, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Agile Methodology, Bias, Business, Coaching, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cybersecurity, Data Analysis Management, Data Collection Management (Inactive), Data Controls, Design Thinking, Development Methodologies, Empathy, Follow\\-Through, Growth Mindset, Implementation Methodologies, Infrastructure Design, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {\\+ 4 more}
 















**What We Can Offer You:** 











**Health \\& Wellbeing** 




 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
 







**Personal \\& Professional Development** 




 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have \\- whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
 







**Diversity, Inclusion \\& Belonging** 




 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
 


















**Let's Stay Connected:** 

























 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
 
























 \\#executive, \\#globalIT
 








**Job:** 



 Information Technology
 
**Job Level:** 



 Director

title: Aerospace Engineer
description:
Aerospace Engineer
 
**The Opportunity:** 




 As an Aerospace Engineer, you know leading\\-edge technologies are critical to national defense. At Booz Allen, you can use your engineering expertise to help develop next\\-generation defense tools and technology. We need your skills in space technologies to help develop creative solutions that directly impact the warfighter.
 







 As an Aerospace Engineer on our team, you'll evaluate new technologies, perform risk assessments, and improve the design of aerospace systems. Your experience in modeling and simulation is key and makes you an integral part of delivering a client\\-focused solution.
 







 If you desire to solve real\\-world challenges and lead mission\\-critical engineering for the Space Force, there's a place here. At Booz Allen, you'll make a difference with us, and, in return, we'll invest in your future.
 







 Join us. The world can't wait.
 







**You Have:** 



* Experience working with modeling and simulation
* Experience with data processing and statistical techniques
* Experience producing technical documentation
* Ability to work collaboratively and resolve issues with multiple customers, stakeholders, and engineers
* Ability to identify, analyze, and resolve technical risks and issues, develop technical reports, and collaborate with government and other stakeholders to implement recommended solutions
* Bachelor's degree in Physics, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Mathematics







**Nice If You Have:** 



* 2\\+ years of experience in data and statistical techniques on large datasets
* 2\\+ years of experience in modeling and simulation of physical phenomena or systems
* Experience with Python or C\\+\\+
* Experience working with Linux environments
* Experience producing original research







**Compensation** 




 At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well\\-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work\\-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full\\-time and part\\-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen's benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
 






 Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract\\-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $67,700\\.00 to $154,000\\.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen's total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
 




**Identity Statement** 




 As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.
 







**Work Model**

* If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you'll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
* If this position is listed as onsite, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.







**Commitment to Non\\-Discrimination**

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
**DSV \\- Global transport and logistics** 
  

 In 1976, ten independent hauliers joined forces and founded DSV in Denmark. Since then, DSV has evolved to become the world's 3rd largest supplier of global solutions within transport and logistics. Today, we add value to our customers' entire supply chain by transporting, storing, packaging, re\\-packaging, processing and clearing all types of goods. We work every day from our many offices in more than 80 countries to ensure a steady supply of goods to production lines, outlets, stores and consumers all over the world. Our reach is global yet our presence is local and close to our customers.  
 



  
 



 Read more at www.dsv.com 
 



  
 



 Location: USA \\- Houston, 831 
 



 Division: Group 
   

 Job Posting Title: Senior Business Analyst 
   

 Time Type: Full Time
 



  
 



**Summary** 
  

 The Senior Business Analyst (BA) is in charge of overall integration projects for customers, from the initial analysis, through all CINTO projects steps to the hypercare. They manage the scope, quality and makes sure the solution is delivered by the required date.
 



  
 



**Duties and Responsibilities** 




     Effectively executing complex integrations or major projects in EDI according to its schedule and budget.
   

     Analyzing DSV customers' requirements and prepare technical specifications. 
   

     Analyze and estimate the work effort to implement new solutions.
   

     Creation or modification of complex interfaces based on existing standard solutions, ensuring high quality using test scenarios.
   

     Creating detailed specifications and documentation based on existing operational procedures.
   

     Maintain timely, efficient and proactive stakeholder communication regarding the daily tasks and projects.
   

     Support business and the organization to identify any possible cooperation with the EDI department.
   

     Help and support other team members to achieve their potential within the department.
   

     Compliance with internal regulations, procedures, law and managers orders, including labor regulations, regulations on remuneration and other internal regulations in the company, including company's intellectual property protection. 
   

     Behaviors and attitudes consistent with the values of the organization.
   

     Professional skills development by participation in training and constant self\\-education.
 



  

**Requirements Analysis and Specification Build** 
  

     Assist in a pre\\-sales phase as needed.
   

     Gathers customer/business requirements and needs,
   

     Analysis obtained requirements to design suitable solution.
   

     Consult non\\-standard requirement with Developer.
   

     Create the map specification (using GEFEG.fx)
   

     Follows standard guidelines and practises.
   

     Document the work done according to the agreed format/way.
   

     Coordinates with other IT teams if it's required.
 



  

**Development, Quality and Testing** 
  

     Manage changes in the scope, re\\-estimate and re\\-plan work if needed. 
   

     Support developer in communication with business requestor.
   

     Carry out Product Tests to make sure the solution works as designed.
   

     Oversees the UAT process.
   

     Coordinate the deployment into production.
 



  
 



**Hypercare** 
  

     Help to understand or provide guidance for Hypercare process.
   

     Support troubleshooting if it's requested by EDI Support (Silver Hypercare), take ownership of troubleshooting (Platinum Hypercare).
 



  
 



**General and Time** 
  

     Track project progress against planned dates
   

     Maintain timely, efficient and proactive stakeholder communication regarding the daily tasks and projects.
 



  
 



**Priority, Escalations** 
  

     Escalates encountered issues to Team Lead and CINTO.
   

     Escalates priority conflicts to Team Lead and CINTO.
 



  
 



**Educational background / Work experience** 
  

     Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Computer Science, or related field. 
   

     5\\+ years of experience in business analysis, data analysis, or a related field. 
   

     Experience in the transportation and logistics industry is preferred.
 



  
 



**Skills \\& Competencies** 
  

     Extensive expertise in EDI standards, particularly UN/EDIFACT and ANSI\\-X12, demonstrating the ability to navigate complex EDI landscapes.
   

     In\\-depth knowledge of communication protocols critical to EDI processes, including FTP, SFTP, and AS2, with proven hands\\-on implementation experience.
   

     Significant experience working in multicultural, self\\-organized teams, showcasing leadership and adaptability in diverse environments.
   

     Advanced proficiency in XML, XPATH, and SQL, with the ability to manage and troubleshoot complex data flows.
   

     Comprehensive understanding of EDI transactions within Transport.
   

     Strong analytical thinking and exceptional communication skills, enabling effective problem\\-solving and stakeholder collaboration.
 



  
 



**Required Skills** 
  

     Vast knowledge of EDI Standards (EDIFACT or ANSI X12\\).
   

     Vast knowledge of XML.
   

     Vast Experience implementing IT projects with Agile methods.
   

     Knowledge of communication protocols such as FTP, SFTP, AS2 or HTTP.
   

     Communicativeness and analytical skills. 
 



  
 



**Preferred Qualifications** 
  

     Master's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Computer Science, or related field. 
   

     Certification in business analysis (e.g., CBAP, PMI\\-PBA).
 



  
 



**Language skills** 
  

     Fluent in English (oral and written)
 



  
 



**Computer Literacy** 
  

     Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). 
 



     Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau.
 



  
 



**At Will Employment** 
  

 DSV Air \\& Sea Inc. employees are hired for an undefined period of time as "at will" employees. This means that an employee may be terminated for any reason, or no reason at all, at any time, provided the discharge does not violate any law\\*. Additionally, each employee has the right to terminate his/her employment at any time. \\*Except if employed in Montana, where termination requires just cause.
 



  

  
 



 DSV is an equal employment opportunity employer. Candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, age, sex, religion, ancestry, disability, veteran status, marital status, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. If you require special assistance or accommodation while seeking employment with DSV, please contact Human Resources at hr@us.dsv.com. If you are interested in learning the status of your application, please note you will be contacted directly by the appropriate human resources contact person if you are selected for further consideration. DSV reserves the right to defer or close a vacancy at any time.
 



  
 



 For this position, the expected base pay is:
 **$64,000\\- $86,000 / Annual** 
 .  Actual base compensation will be determined based on various factors including job\\-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations.
 



 DSV does not accept unsolicited agency resumes.  Please do not forward unsolicited resumes to our website, employees, or Human Resources.  DSV will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes.  Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of DSV and will be processed accordingly without fees.
 



  
 



**DSV \\- Global transport and logistics** 




 DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You'll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high\\-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature's terms.
 



  
 



 We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we'll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.
 



  
 



 Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

title: Operator - Close Interval Survey Crew (Oil and Gas Pipelines)
description:
**Job Description:** 




 The Operator for the Close Interval Survey Crew is responsible for conducting surveys on oil and gas pipelines to assess their integrity, identify potential corrosion issues, and ensure safe and efficient operations. This role involves working with a crew to perform close interval surveys (CIS), a key method of pipeline monitoring that helps assess the effectiveness of cathodic protection systems and identify any areas that may require maintenance or repair.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Close Interval Survey (CIS) Execution:** 
 Conduct close interval surveys along pipelines using specialized equipment to measure the electrical potential of the pipeline and assess the efficiency of cathodic protection systems.
* **Data Collection:** 
 Gather accurate data on pipeline conditions, corrosion levels, and the effectiveness of protection systems. Record the readings meticulously for analysis.
* **Equipment Operation:** 
 Operate and maintain survey equipment, including potential measuring devices, data loggers, and other specialized tools to ensure correct operation during surveys.
* **Safety Compliance:** 
 Adhere to safety procedures and protocols to ensure safe work practices while operating in potentially hazardous environments, including working near pipelines, in remote locations, or in proximity to heavy machinery.
* **Report Generation:** 
 Compile field data into comprehensive reports, noting areas of concern, and assist in the analysis and interpretation of survey data.
* **Collaboration:** 
 Work as part of a close\\-knit crew, coordinating with fellow operators, supervisors, engineers, and project managers to complete the survey work within required timelines.
* **Maintenance \\& Calibration:** 
 Perform routine maintenance, troubleshooting, and calibration of survey equipment to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the measurements.
* **Environmental Awareness:** 
 Ensure minimal environmental impact while conducting surveys, adhering to environmental regulations, and contributing to sustainability initiatives.



**Qualifications:** 



* **Education:** 
 High school diploma or equivalent. Technical certifications related to pipeline integrity, cathodic protection, or relevant fields are preferred.
* **Experience:** 
	+ Previous experience in pipeline surveys, cathodic protection systems, or related fields is highly desirable.
	+ Experience with Close Interval Surveys (CIS), pipeline maintenance, or similar technical tasks is a significant advantage.
	+ Familiarity with industry\\-standard survey equipment and software.
* **Skills:** 
	+ Ability to operate and troubleshoot specialized survey equipment.
	+ Strong attention to detail and ability to accurately collect, record, and analyze data.
	+ Knowledge of pipeline integrity management, corrosion control, and safety practices in the oil and gas industry.
	+ Good communication skills for effective reporting and collaboration with crew members and supervisors.
	+ Ability to work in outdoor, sometimes challenging, environments (weather conditions, remote locations, etc.)
	+ **Certifications:** 
	  A valid driver's license and any relevant safety certifications (e.g., H2S, first aid/CPR, OSHA) are preferred.



**Physical Demands:** 



* Ability to work in remote locations and potentially hazardous environments.
* Ability to lift and carry heavy equipment (up to 50 pounds).
* Must be comfortable working in various weather conditions, including extreme heat, cold, or rain.
* Ability to walk long distances, climb, and crawl if required during pipeline surveys.



**Work Schedule:** 



* Typically full\\-time with potential for overtime depending on project requirements.
* May require travel to various pipeline locations, often in rural or remote areas.



**Compensation:** 



* Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
* Benefits package may include health insurance, retirement plans, and other incentives.



**Conclusion:** 




 This role is ideal for individuals with a technical background in pipeline systems or integrity management who are looking to contribute to the safety and reliability of oil and gas pipelines. As an Operator in the Close Interval Survey Crew, you will play a key role in monitoring and maintaining the pipeline infrastructure that is essential for energy transportation and ensuring the protection of the environment and public safety.

description:

title: Facility Electrical Engineer
description:
**Facility Electrical Engineer** 
  

**Engineer III** 
  

**NASA Johnson Space Center** 
  

**Houston, Texas** 




 HX5 is an award\\-winning provider of engineering, research and development, and technical services to clients such as NASA and the Department of Defense. Founded in 2004, HX5 is a fast\\-growing veteran\\- and woman\\-owned company with locations nationwide.
 



 HX5 is currently seeking a Facility Electrical Engineer to join the team with NASA at Johnson Space Center (JSC).
 



 As a Facility Electrical Engineer in the Electrical, Data and Controls Section in the Operations and Test Department, you will work in a team environment taking requirements from customers to analyze technical products and systems, and design, develop, implement and test solutions
 



**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** 



* Collaborate with customers and team members to gather and interpret electrical engineering requirements for facility systems.
* Analyze technical products, systems, and data to inform the design and development of electrical solutions.
* Utilize engineering expertise to design electrical systems, including the creation of process and instrumentation drawings (P\\&ID), schematics, and one\\-line diagrams.
* Develop and implement electrical solutions, ensuring integration with existing facility controls and operations.
* Perform rigorous testing of newly implemented electrical systems to ensure they meet customer needs, operational standards, and safety requirements.
* Provide technical support for facility controls and electrical systems, contributing to ongoing operations and maintenance.
* Use a variety of software tools, including MS Office Suite, MS Project, and AutoCAD, for the design, documentation, and project management of electrical systems.
* Apply knowledge of the National Electrical Code (NEC) and other relevant standards to ensure compliance in all engineering activities.



**Education andExperience** 
  

 This position has been posted at multiple levels. Depending on the candidate's experience, requirements and business needs, we reserve the right to consider candidates at any level for which this position has been advertised.
 


* Bachelor's degree in engineering from an ABET\\-accredited engineering school and five (5\\) to ten (10\\) years of relevant experience
